subject: Re: [junit] Same tests with varying initialization?
msgSnippet: public abstract class CommonTestCase extends TestCase { public abstract void doInitialization(); public void testSomething() { doInitialization(); // do the
messageBody:
public abstract class CommonTestCase extends TestCase {
public abstract void doInitialization();

public void testSomething() {
doInitialization();
// do the test
}
}

public class CaseAlphaTestCase extends CommonTestCase {
public void doInitialization() {
// do alpha-specific initialization
}
}

public class CaseBetaTestCase extends CommonTestCase {
public void doInitialization() {
// do beta-specific initialization
}
}

/*

Sometimes, it makes sense to have the doInitialization method return an
instance of some Object that implements a common interface (and then
doInitialization creates an instance of an appropriate concrete class).
Other times, it makes sense to have doInitialization set some common
instance variables (often declared with the interface they implement)
in CommonTestCase.

Regards,

Rob
*/
